meanings.definition: A place where bricks are made or stored.
meanings.sent1: The old brickyard was filled with stacks of red bricks.
meanings.sent2: We visited the brickyard to buy materials for our new patio.
meanings.sent3: The brickyard workers had a competition to see who could stack the most bricks in an hour.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a brickyard of memories, each one carefully stored and preserved.
meanings.sent5: The sun set over the brickyard, casting a warm glow on the rows of bricks.

meanings.definition: A person who works at a brickyard.
meanings.sent1: The brickyard greeted us with the sound of hammers and shovels.
meanings.sent2: My uncle is a skilled brickyard who has been working with clay for years.
meanings.sent3: The brickyard joked that he had bricks for brains after a long day of work.
meanings.sent4: She was a brickyard of knowledge, always ready to help with any building project.
meanings.sent5: The new brickyard on the block quickly became known for his precision and speed.
